sub_topic: Identifying the cut vertices and bridges in a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following graph:

![graph](https://i.imgur.com/DeuO7V0.png)

Identify the cut vertices and bridges in the graph above.
message_2:
A cut vertex (also known as an articulation point) is a vertex whose removal increases the number of connected components in the graph. A bridge (also known as a cut edge) is an edge whose removal increases the number of connected components in the graph.

In the given graph, the cut vertices are B, C, and D. Removing any of these vertices will increase the number of connected components in the graph.

The bridges in the graph are the edges connecting the following pairs of vertices:
1. (A, B)
2. (B, C)
3. (C, D)

Removing any of these edges will increase the number of connected components in the graph.
